content:
To ensure your contact center runs optimally and correctly, review these best practices for Service Cloud Voice:

If an agent misses a call, their status automatically changes to offline. To prevent this, set the Update Status on Push Timeout option to Busy in presence configuration settings.
For inbound, outbound, and transfer calls, consider:
	* If Amazon Connect is the telephony provider, check the agent whisper contact flow if a call transfer fails.
	* If agents use virtual desktops, ensure they have the local media page open for voice calls to connect.
Voice Resiliency:
	* Ensure your contact center supports voice resiliency when conversations exceed the limit or background services are unavailable.
Call Recording and After Conversation Work:
	* After conversation work is available only during connected calls. Service channel settings override presence configuration settings.
Agent Flag and Whisper:
	* Agents must be online in the Omni-Channel widget to raise flags or send whisper messages.
Phone Number Format:
	* Avoid ambiguous or invalid phone number formats when dialing numbers or linking them from inbound calls.
Add Callers and Transfer Calls:
	* If Amazon Connect is the telephony provider, ensure contacts are added to Quick Connects and queues.
Omni Supervisor:
	* Assign Contact Center Supervisor permission set to supervisors. Verify queue settings under supervisor configurations.
Sandboxes:
	* When setting up Voice in a sandbox, perform a partial copy sandbox refresh. Turn on Conversation Insights in production org before copying it to a sandbox.

These best practices ensure optimal contact center performance and functionality with Service Cloud Voice.
title: Best Practices for Service Cloud Voice
